chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Christina H. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christina H. Patterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christina H. Patterson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4:03 p.m. Defendant Christina H. Patterson not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has complied with agreement - State moves to dismiss - Granted. Adj. 4:03 p.m.

records.addlTxt: from JA directing payment of attorney fees

02:46 pm - Defendant Christina H. Patterson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 3.  Plea questionnaire filed.  DPA filed for Count 3.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and defers judgment in Count 3 and accepts the DPA.  Schiek/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence - Count 2
WHS/POP 1 yr
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge/Domestic Abuse Surcharge/Supervision Fees
May not consume or possess intoxicants/controlled substances or non prescribed drugs
Take medications as prescribed and in dosage and manner prescribed
Follow through with all MD recommendations
Follow all conditions of court orders concerning child
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

03:33 pm - Defendant Christina H. Patterson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cirilli in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:15 a.m. Defendant Christina H. Patterson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli waives preliminary on behalf of defendant; attorney has advised defendant of her rights given up. Court finds waiver free and voluntar; finds probable cause exists and binds over. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

03:02 pm - Defendant Christina H. Patterson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 11:15 am.
from JA - appointing Gary Cirilli - to pay $20/month

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns. May not consume any prescription medication or illegal substances unless prescribed and then take prescribed medications only as prescribed and in manner/dosage prescribed.  No contact with J.P. and/or common child unless supervised by Social Services and/or persons authorized by Social Services.  Comply with Settlement agreement.  Comply with any conditions set by Social Services Dept.

01:24 pm - Defendant Christina H. Patterson in court, via video,  with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Defendant Christina H. Patterson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states contacted the PD office and was informed was not eligible.  Hogan will appear for today's purposes.  Schiek/Hogan to bond.  Court address Ms. Lee from Social Services concerning child placement.  Court sets sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
